TopicTitle: what version of the game did you download first?

Articles.Content: Can't believe there aren't more of us Steam Summer Sale people here!
They use the Steam forums possibly? That or they haven't made it around to playing KSP because of all the other Summer Sale games they bought and are currently playing.
I downloaded the first public release, back before the game cost anything.

You seem to be missing some versions there...You could buy/play the game before .14

EDIT: Oh cheers, about my 1,500th post! Joy! And my first version was .10. No Mun, just clean stars as far as the eye could see.

Edited July 23, 2013 by swiftgates24
Bought the game at 0.15. It was the jet engines that really wanted me to get the game, and ironically, I suck at planes.
.14 vetran baby!

0.19!

(10 characters)
0.9 It's been a while. =)
0.7.2, after (one of) the first thread(s) for it on /v/
.20.2, first got the demo then bought it Best $23 I ever spent in my life.

bought the game a few days after 0.14 came out, but the first version I downloaded was either 0.9 or 0.10

EDIT: scratch that, my first version was 0.8.5. It was right before struts were implemented.

Edited July 23, 2013 by AlternNocturn

0.13.2.

First paid version for me was 0.14x1

In fact, that WAS the first paid version.
I bought KSP right after 0.18 came out. I still can't believe that this game flew under my radar for so long...

I forget now with version it was exactly, but I started in the late summer in 2011, I think (was that when it was first out to the public?) It was at least a version or two before the Mun was released, back before I had any clue how to orbit.

I bought the game when it first came out for sale, back at a wonderful $7. It's probably the best $-to-hours/enjoyment I've ever spent.

I've long since forgotten the Farker that had posted this in a thread there, but I wish I could have thanked him/her for pointing out such a great game.

Edited July 23, 2013 by MonkeyFuzz
I found out about the game right after 0.14 was released. Right after.

I THINK it was .18? Played the .13.3 demo with the NP demo mod.

I spent two days trying to download it after slashdot melted the servers....Skunky linked to it in a response on educational games if I remember correctly. I was on the road (Semi Truck driver) and trying to download the demo over a 3g connection that refused to stay connected. Bought it the day I got home after playing the demo for several days.....coolest demo I ever played...I laughed my head off on the first launch as they screamed all the way up. And then learned the term 'lithobraking' the hard way.

I bought it Dec 23rd, I was going to buy Black OPs II for Christmas....But got KSP for $17 u.s. instead. 326 hrs later (since going on Steam the first day Steam keys were offered) I think I made the better choice.

Still have not bought Black Ops II.....
I came in about a year and 2 months ago. Back then, .15 was fairly new.
0.20.2 from the Steam sale and then the KSP store. For some reason I can't vote in the poll though

The first version I downloaded KSP was 0.8, fun times.

EDIT: This pole isn't correct, it should have begun at 0.7.3 which was the first version released to the public.

Edited July 24, 2013 by Jon Tash

0.9

I find your Poll Illogical.
I played the .13 Demo for a week before buying the game in .15.
13.3 demo, bought it at .15.x
I am pretty sure the version that I first downloaded was the current version, 0.21.1. If I'm correct then I cannot accurately respond to the poll
